title: Symbolic Links
content:
What is a symlink?

A symbolic link is a special file that points to another path.

Create and inspect

cd ~/unix-cli-practice
mkdir -p links-demo
cd links-demo
echo "data" > target.txt
ln -s target.txt link.txt
ls -la
cat link.txt

Why symlinks are useful

  • Create convenient shortcuts
  • Switch versions by changing the link target
  • Avoid duplication of large files
